nav.div: Northwest Allen County Schools » News » Coronavirus - COVID-19 Information

div.p: Please see communication sent to NACS parents, students and staff about COVID-19. Scroll down to access additional information and useful resources.

p.span:
NACS COMMUNICATION
4.8.2020 Dr. Himsel logistics letter about the rest of school year
COVID Update Letter to Parents 20200408.pdf
Remote Learning Schedule Updated 20200408.pdf
Remote Learning tech support for accessing a Google Meet, a Canvas Conference, or other technology-related resources may be found here:
https://www.nacs.k12.in.us/parents.
Meal pick-up and delivery service is now ONLY offered on Tuesdays, between 11 a.m. and 1 p.m. at Carroll High School and Huntertown Elementary. Distribution will be breakfast and lunch (meal kit) for a five-day period. Pick-up for meals is also available 5:30 to 6:30 p.m., currently. Questions should be directed to either (260) 637-8768, or (260) 338-0802.
4.2.2020 NACS to finish 2019-2020 school year via Remote Learning--per Gov. Holcomb
COVID closure updates 20200402.pdf
3.24.2020 New meal pick-up and delivery schedule

: In light of the Governor’s shut-down announcement and our need to protect everyone’s health, NACS is adjusting meal distribution. We will phase into a weekly distribution of meals this week. Starting Tuesday, March 24, we will provide 2 meal kits per student. The next meal distribution will be Thursday, March 26, wherein we will have 3 sets of meals per student ready. Due to the volume of meals, we can no longer insure allergy-free meals. We apologize for that inconvenience. Thank you so much for your flexibility during this unprecedented time; we love y(our) kids.
If your circumstances change, please contact us at (260) 637-3161 or (260) 338-0802 to find out options.

div.p: 3.11.2020 Due to the health concerns about the COVID-19 virus, FAME is cancelling the FAME Festival which was to be held. On March 14-15, 2020 at the Grand Wayne Center. No alternate date is available to reschedule this spring.
